newsitem.title: UK: Amerada Hess Telford North Sea field to peak early.
newsitem.headline: Amerada Hess Telford North Sea field to peak early.

text.p: Amerada Hess's Telford field in the central North Sea should reach peak production of some 30,000 barrels per day (bpd) by the end of this year, a company official said on Thursday.
The field started pumping at a rate of 10,000 bpd on October 23, over two months ahead of schedule and less than a year after the British government granted development approval.
"The way in which we have been able to bring Telford on stream so early has been a reflection of close co-operation within our partnership group," said project manager Sandy Paterson.
"This enabled us, together with the Amoco reservoir engineering team, to develop a highly effective appraisal drilling strategy," he added.
Operator Hess holds 31.42 percent of the field, which includes the Marmion discovery, while Amoco (UK) and Enterprise Oil Plc each have 20.16 percent.
The rest of the equity is divided between Mobil North Sea (15.65 percent), Deminex UK Oil and Gas (9.42 percent), Kerr McGee Oil (2.35 percent) and Premier Pict Petroleum (0.81 percent).

Oil from Telford, with estimated recoverable reserves of about 48 million barrels of oil and 74 billion cubic feet of gas, will be exported via a subsea tieback to Hess's Scott platform to the Forties system.
Gas will be pumped into the SAGE system.
